text:
Safety directions
	The following shall be inserted in Part IV of the Merchant Shipping Act[1995 (c. 21)](/id/ukpga/1995/21?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")(safety) after section 108 (births and deaths)—
	“108ASafety directions
		Schedule 3A (safety directions) shall have effect.
		A provision made by or by virtue of this Act (including one which createsan offence) shall have no effect in so far as it—
			is inconsistent with the exercise by or on behalf of the Secretary of Stateof a power under Schedule 3A (safety directions),
			would interfere with a person’s compliance with a direction under thatSchedule, or
			would interfere with action taken by virtue of that Schedule.”
		Before Schedule 4 to that Act there shall be inserted new Schedule 3A setout in Schedule 1 to this Act.
Fire authorities: power to charge
	Section 3 of the Fire Services Act [1947 (c.41)](/id/ukpga/1947/41?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (fireauthority: supplementary powers) shall be amended as follows.
	In subsection (1)(e) (purposes other than fire-fighting) after “suitable”insert “(whether in their area, in another authority’s area or at sea (whetheror not within the territorial sea of the United Kingdom))”.
	After subsection (4) (charges) insert—
		“(4A)A fire authority in England or Wales may make a charge for a servicewhich is rendered for fire-fighting purposes—
		under subsection (1)(dd) above, and
		outside the area of every fire authority in Great Britain.”
	At the end of section 37 of the Fire Services Act [1947 (c.41)](/id/ukpga/1947/41?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (Isles ofScilly) there shall be added “; and for the purposes of section 3(4A) theCouncil is a fire authority in England.”
Amendments and repeals
	Schedule 2 (minor and consequential amendments) shall have effect.
	The enactments listed in Schedule 3 are hereby repealed to the extentspecified.
Commencement 
	This Act shall come into force at the end of the period of two monthsbeginning with the date on which it is passed.
Extent 
	This Act extends to the whole of the United Kingdom.
	But section 2 extends to England and Wales only.
Short Title
	This Act may be cited as the Marine Safety Act 2003.
